page.title: 15ANIMAL HUSBANDRY
page.content:
{SHEEP FARMING} The most commom breeds of sheep likely to be encountered in the area are either Border Leicesters, Mashams, or Border Mashams.
Generally the early spring lambs are taken to market and sold for slaughter at 14 weeks old, 30 weeks being regarded as the top limit. The mature sheep are sheared in May and the fleece is sold to the Wool Marketing Board.
{PIG FARMING} The favourite breed for the area is the Landrace X Large White, usually kept in purpose built brick structures, well lit and ventilated. Adjustable size internal pens are provided with separate enclosures to suit the size of individual animals.
